title: Holding the Guitar
summary: Learn how to sit and hold the guitar correctly.
keyPoints: Sit tall with your back supported, not slouched
Rest the guitar on your thigh or use a strap while seated
Angle the neck slightly upward for easy reach
Keep shoulders relaxed and elbows loose
Let your fretting hand float without gripping the neck
Adjust strap height so the guitar feels stable
commonMistakes: Holding the neck too low or too high
Clamping the guitar with your picking arm
practiceDrill: Sit, set posture, and check shoulder relaxation
Lift and lower the neck angle until your wrist feels neutral
Strum open strings while keeping the guitar steady
Repeat twice with a strap and without
